ExampleDefinition.ToolTipDescription: Demonstrates zooming of SciChart by dragging an area: Overlays two series on a SciChartSurface and applies the RubberBandXyZoomModifier. This is a built-in ChartModifierBase derived class which adds the behavior of zooming when you mouse-drag an area. Uses secondary Y-Axis to demontrate zooming with multiple axes
ExampleDefinition.Description:
Showcases how to add zooming to a SciChartSurface using the [url='https://www.scichart.com/documentation/win/current/webframe.html#RubberBandXyZoomModifier.html']RubberBandXyZoomModifier[/url]. This ChartModifier can be added to the SciChartSurface via the [url='http://www.scichart.com/documentation/win/current/SciChart.Charting~SciChart.Charting.Visuals.SciChartSurface~ChartModifier.html']SciChartSurface.ChartModifier[/url] property, or via a [url='http://www.scichart.com/documentation/win/current/SciChart.Charting~SciChart.Charting.ChartModifiers.ModifierGroup.html']ModifierGroup[/url]
The RubberBandXyZoomModifier may be restricted in the X-Axis only (in which case the Y-Axis autoranges according to RubberBandXyZoomModifier.AutoRangeY), or unbounded, in which case it zooms to the exact rectangle you draw. The rectangle may be styled. Zoom can be undone using the [url='https://www.scichart.com/documentation/win/current/webframe.html#ZoomHistoryManager.html']ZoomHistoryManager[/url].
Also try double-clicking to zoom to extents. This feature is provided by the [url='https://www.scichart.com/documentation/win/current/webframe.html#ZoomExtentsModifier.html']ZoomExtentsModifier[/url].
